title: What are the latest business news of August 10, 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: Business news #4 - August 10, 2020 1) BCCI gets Central Govt's approval to conduct IPL 2020 in UAE.  As of IPL owned by Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI), Brijesh Patel, the chairman of the IPL on Monday clarified that the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has got the government approval to go ahead with the tournament in the UAE.IPL 2020 will be organized in the UAE from Sep 19-Nov 10 and the tournament will run for 53 days.2) India will ban the import of 101 defense equipment.  Defense minister Rajnath Singh on Sunday, 09 August announced that India will ban the import of 101 defense equipment.And clarified that equipment will be manufactured in the country India under the Atmnirbhar Bharat initiative.The list of pieces of equipment includes: Artillery gunsAssault riflescorvettesSonar systemTransport aircraft3) Reliance Industries' retail arm has been valued at approx worth $83 billion USD.  And in addition to Chairman Mukesh Ambani said that “we will induct global partners and investors in Reliance Retail in the next few quarters”. 4) The Delhi government on Friday sent notices to firms for not filing tax returns.  The government of Delhi sent notices to 5,584 in the city for not filling tex returns. In 2019, the Delhi government had collected around 5,792 crore INR in tax returns from January to March.But this year in 2020 the collection of tax from January to March was only 3,777 crore INR.5) Microsoft’s co-founder Bill Gates has described the company’s potential acquisition of TikTok’s US operation as a ‘poison chalice’.  6) Bangaluru based fresh-fish and meat delivery startup FreshtoHome is raising 122 crores INR funding.  7) Google may acquire a 10% stack in online insurance platform PolicyBazaar for $150 million USD.  8) The government of India announced 24 apps as the winners of the Atmanirbhar Bharat App Innovation Challange.  9) Zoom CEO Eric Yuan at Tie’s said that India is the second-largest market in the world in terms of users of ZOOM.  And added that “I think Zoom will have great DNA in India ”. 10) FedEx and UPS Shares Surge Amid Holiday Fee Hikes  According to Bloomberg, UPS plans to add a holiday surcharge of up to $4 per package for those who ship more than 25,000 parcels (deliveries) a week.
